Let there be no lack of hospitality among our people. Of late years a narrow spirit has taken possession of some living at our large centers. There are some who think that they should receive pay for entertaining God's servants. Thus they lose the sweetest blessings. Lack of hospitality has turned souls away from the truth.--Ms 6, 1902. 





Ellen G. White Estate Washington, D.C. April 13, 1989. Entire Ms.
